intro: Samyda mexicana, commonly known as the Mexican samoyed, is a flowering plant native to Mexico. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes cotton and hibiscus. The plant features palmate leaves with five to seven lobes and produces yellow flowers that bloom in the spring. It is often found in dry, rocky habitats and is valued for its ornamental appeal. Samyda mexicana is also used in traditional medicine for its purported healing properties.
